reviewText: No more room in hell is a game about surviving the zombie apocalypse, but before you all sigh from boredom as you contemplate the ever growing mountain of zombie games cluttering up your steam library, let me finish. This is one of the only zombie games in which you play as a fat guy fending off the undead. At laest that's the only reason that i can come up with as to why your character's movement speed is so appallingly slow. It also makes more attempts at realism by giving you a limited inventory with smaller and bigger items taking up a certain amount of space. In attition, there is quite a detailed level of item tweeking you can do. You have your melee weapons' heavy and light attacks, your gun's have safety switches, fire settings, ammo check and ironsight aiming. You have first aid kits, bandiges, anti-infection pills, torches, pipe bombs and molotovs. The one thing you don't have however, is a HUD which gives the impression that you are actually a person in the middle of a crisis. All in all, there are certainly worst free-to-play games and four player co-op is available as well, so that's nice.

reviewText:
This game is a masterpiece. Even though it might not appear tobe much on the outside, after all, it is a Half-Life 2 mod, it is surprisingly fun, and never really gets boring. You have a wide array of guns at your disposal, along with unique melee weapons, from kitchen knives to chainsaws. There are two gamemodes, objective and survival.
Objective has you and a group of other survivors get from Point A to Point B, while completing objectives along the way to get rescue. Survival has you and other survivors defending zones from waves of zombies, with scripted supply drops.

One of the best aspects of this game is it's focus on teamwork. While objective is possible to solo, it is still hard, and survival is practically impossible without a team. Where it really becomes noticable is in certain objectivd missions, though.
For examples, Cabin has you hooking a car battery up to a generator to call for rexcue, except the generator is surrounded by zombies, requiring one of the survivors to grab the battery, and the others protect him.

Another aspect is that this game is actually quite difficult. Ammunition tends to be scarce, requring you to only take shots that you really need to take, instead of just mowing down hordes with a run-n-gun strategy. Every time a zombie bits you, you have a chance of bleeding or infection. Bleeding does damage to you over time, and can only be stopped by bandages, while infection is permanent, and can only be put off for three minutes by taking pills.

One of the best loadouts is the SKS, Beretta M9, and Baseball Bat.

Play this game, it is absolutly fantastic.

Это самая хардкордная игра про зомби-аппокалипсис,в которую,я когда либо играл,и моя самая любимая. Начать думаю с того,что сначало еще до того как ее добавить в свою библиотеку(а она бесплатная),думал ну обычная зомби стрелялка,трейлер впечатлил,ну решил добавить,загрузил и зашел сразу в игру,понравилась очень мелодия которая играла в главном меню,душевная и дающая понять что еще не все потеряно,ладно заговорился. Первая и моя любимая карта это Broadway,как только зашел в нее,первое просто прислушивался к атмосфере игры,она здесь проста восхитительна,именно на этой карте,слышишь как куда-то летит вертолет,вой зомби,крики людей,выстрелы за пару кварталов от тебя,полицейские сирены которые отдаляются от тебя...и ты лишь через некоторое время понимаешь что тебя никто не придет спасать,ты сам должен выбираться и искать выход из этого ужасного места.Расскажу по подробнее об игровой механике,в этой игре у вас не получится убивать всех зомби быстро и парочкой выстрелов как в ''Left 4 Dead 2'',здесь самый настоящий хардкор и если вы его не любите то вы не по адресу,что-ж продолжу,все оружие в игре хорошо сбалансировано,нету такого оружие которое будет всех убивать с одного выстрела нужно стрелять точно в голову и экономить патроны,они здесь на вес золота,так же само и про холодное оружие хочу сказать,главный герой им махаться долго не сможет,он просто выдохнется и вас сожрут зомби,или вас могут еще заразить и вы через некоторое время будете нападать на ваших товарищей по команде,а еще ваш персонаж много не сможет взять с собой вещей в инвентарь,что-то придется выкинуть,берите всего понемножку и то что вам больше всего пригодится,так-же в игре присутствует выбор персонажей,хоть их личности не раскрыты,но уже есть разнообразие,карт довольно таки достаточно,они разделены на две категории,те где нужно выполнять миссии что-бы спастись и сдерживание волн зомби,так же еще есть еще пользавательские карты сделанные исключительно фанатами этой игры,после прохождения всех оригинальных карт,можете попробывать пользовательские карты,ну и на этом хочу подвести итоги + и -
+Атмосфера
+Кооператив
+Зомби-аппокалипсии
+Интересные ачивменты

-Хардкор(вас убьют или загрызут)
-Новичкам сложно освоится в этой игре,пару дней нужно поиграть что-бы понять что к чему

reviewText:
Product received for free

This game is truly amazing. It stands up to its purpose and motto. It entertains people for hours and hours. There are alot of things to discover in this fantastic game and the first thing you will discover is FUN! It's horror theme matches with the game concept.

Once you enter the game the fun and adventure qualities will immediately help you enjoy the game. Although you may think all is lost once you and your team are almost destroyed by the zombies, you'll notice the need to bash their head in with Fubar, reunite, dont give up, and to make it to the end.

Finishing a map feels so good. Knowing that you survived an apocalypse and did it with a few people and got extracted by the military is amazing isn't it? A game this amazing and smartly made is just cool. I would really play it.

Overall score for me:

9.5/10
Fun Factor: Good for halloween gaming and could really make you happy.
Lagginess Level: Even low-spec computers can handle this game really easily.
Values to be distributed: Strength, Determination, and Teamwork

2 Words to describe this game: Pure Fun.

reviewText:
I have played many zombie game in my life which of some I have bought but No More Room in Hell has been the best zombie game I have ever played. Its immense important on team work makes the game much more enjoyable. Virtually everytime I play objective maps, I find myself making new friends. This game also somewhat builds character. It puts players on the spot on what to do in a given situation.

This game is not a 'Run and Gun' game like Left 4 Dead. It's very slow paced which hightens suspense. You actually feel quite good when you and your mates succesfully complete a level together tactically.

I seriously could not ask for a better game. Thank you.

reviewText:
Selling argument: You can't go wrong with free, and luckily there's a lot more to it.

When NMRiH first appeared as a downloadable mod it was an unstable mess of latency issues and unresponsive hitboxes. But despite all of that it still left such a convincing first impression, you could feel all that potential that it had something worth sticking around for.

Now as a standalone game, systems and core elements have been reworked and refined, fully capable of giving any traditional zombie fan an enjoyable experience.

To perform well you will have to remain rational and very open minded, there may not be any more room in hell but there's definitely a lot more room for error that can fling you to an unforgiving death.

reviewText:
This game is alright, it's more about planning and teamwork.

L4D2's campaign/objective missions is a walk in the park compared to No More Room in Hell, all the zombies/infected humanoids are capable of murdering you in a good two-four hits.

Guns are relatively useless, they usually don't kill a zombie in one or two hits and ammo is severely scarce.

Game is only recommended if you play with friends and have an voice chatting program like mumble, skype, oovoo, etc. I mean they have voice chat, but its turned off once you die and alive players can't hear you.

This game also has a learning curve and when i mean learning curve, I mean kill all little black children immediately before they rush you down, kill the little white girl as well, and kite around regular slow zombies.

reviewText: A fun, FREE, addicting, and all-together great game with a generally kind and helpful community, No More Room in Hell has just the right amount of everything: horror, multiplayer, zombies, guns, and flesh-seeking toddlers! reviewText:
The best zombie survival game ive ever played, this isnt your regular zombie game. guns arent always available and ammo is sparce. You need to be aware of everything around you and where you are. This game pushes you to the limits when it comes to teamwork. There is absolutely no way to win this if you dont work as a team. You need to defend zones or do specific tasks in order to survive the zombie apocalypse. This is probably the most realistic zombie game you will find. If you like survival games you will love this game. It a great game to kill some time and play with friends. It is also one of the hardest games ive ever played. Its going to take a while before you successfully survive or escape in a map. Once you know what you're doing though, its incredible fun.

Pros:
-You need to coordinate with your teammates. I see this more as a pro than a con, but I know some people will see it as a con when you get teammates who are just wasting ammo and dying. But being forced to work together whether its with strangers,friends, or both makes the game realistic and really give you the feeling of i cant survive the zombie apocalypse alone
date:
i have to work with people i may never meet in real life"
-Realistic environment
-Really requires you to think about what you are doing
-Variety of weapons
-Tons of zombies to kill :D

Cons:
-The characters have no personality. You can choose from voice sets but no personality slightly makes the game feel less realistic.
-No variety of characters. Most wont see this as a downside But all the characters are male caucasian adults besides one who is african american. No old survivors or young survivors
recommended: no females. They are working on a female character but for now this is a pretty noticable downside.\n-Beginners will be turned off by long respawn times in conjunction with them dying multiple times. This comes with a lot of games but most dont have really long respawn times which is the next round
hoursPlayed: which can last up to ten more minutes if your teammates are having trouble and dont have the items to start hunting.\n\nI definitely recommend the game even with those cons. The characters cons arent too big a problem and easy to get over and theyre very small points. In terms of long respawn times

reviewText:
Most likely the most fun and perfected mod on Steam.

In this game you will be shooting your friends, being overrun my zombies and throwing chainsaws about.
No More Room in Hell is a very fun game to play and everybody I know can run it regardless of their system specs, it's also somewhat realistic.
Zombies will grab hold of you and never let you go, you must attack them and kill them to get them away from you otherwise you'll be killed very quickly.
The range of weapons you find is just crazy, you can get things from sledgehammers to chainsaws, in my opinion the game is very difficult but is much easier if you can get friends to help out, this is a team game and if you don't work at a team you're very likely to die a painful death being eaten my zombies.

I love this game and so do most my friends, it's sure the best mod on Steam, and a great free-to-play. You must play this game or at least try it, the levels will get you hooked until you complete them. (They're quite difficult)

If you enjoy this game as much as be you'd agree with my 9/10 rating, the only downside is that because it's a mod they're limited with physics and it'd be nice to see some graphical improvements.

reviewText: Someone took Left 4 Dead and made it realistic. To those who don't know, NMRiH is a zombie survival-horror game that intensifies the experience of an actual zombie apocalypse. Weapons and supplies are scarce, so you can't just charge through each level and blast any zombie that comes your way to pieces, along with almost every corner of each level engulfed in darkness. Strength is in numbers, making going it alone rather difficult with the crowds of the undead trying to stop you dead in your tracks. (no pun intended) And getting bit by one of these zombies will cost you dearly, for within seconds begins the process of turning, so you won't be blessed with the gift of immunity. Despite all these factors that must be taken into consideration, it's a fun game to play with anyone, and is a challenge to those who find L4D or any other zombie game too based on action or too easy. The game is free and the soundtrack that's available for purchase is fantastic, so what are you waiting for? Go get the game!

reviewText:
Played cabin with 2 random people , one of them was secretly using pills(in the underground level he was doing it in dark so we cant see him).We got split up while we were trying to fuel the generator for the radio thingy to work. I was holding zombies off from the control room. We all had walkie talkies.The one that was using pills didnt talk for a while.He was supposed to unweld our vantage point.I met with the other guy.While walking to the vantage point we saw our friend's zombie runner body.He ran and bit the guy near me. i blew the zombies head off.The guy was infected .He couldnt walk and more zombies were coming.The rescue guy kept saying in walkie talkie that he doesnt have enough fuel.I put a buckshot in the guys head and kept walking to the vantage.Then i realized the door that leads outside is welded.The pills guy didnt had time to unweld it.I ran back towards his dead body in case its still in his inventory.Zombies were swarming around.I emptied my bullets on them but there were just too many.I ran into a bedroom.I could see the helicopter hovering from a window there,then it left.The door opened and i got gang ♥♥♥♥♥.

another story because i love this game:
me and a mate were playing survival. reviewText:
Very fun concept, but it's just a rip off of Left4Dead or Brainbread (HL Mod).

This game is very unstable and will crash multiple times. I'm running XP with AMD FX-60 (X2), 3 gigs of ram, and a EVGA GTS 450. The framerate is smooth but this game simply crashes. One of my friends claims it does the same to her.

Once it gets fixed I wouldn't hesitate to spend $5 - $10 on it. However, Left4Dead and DayZ will dominate the PC zombie horror market until then.

Thanks and I love you all

<3 <3
Jeff

reviewText:
It's free. Freeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee. Completely and truly freeeeeeeeeee. That fact alone gives no excuse to not try this game out.

Realistic zombies (they look lonely, give one a hug :3). Realistic jumping (bunny hop). Realistic fatigue (nooo no no no nononono pick your arms up pickyourarmsup hit him hit him HIT HIM!). Not-so-realistic arrow flight paths (completely straight at any range? no drop? wut.)

Right off the bat, anyone will notice that this game has a particularly high difficulty curve. Pretty much gotta hit the ground running with this one. It's a good idea to look up all the controls, items, effects, and statuses BEFORE playing it. Check out the wiki while downloading it, but be prepared for a LOT of reading.

But isn't there a tutorial?" Not an in-game one. In fact

reviewText:
This game is an excillent, must get game for pc. It is free, and will have you spending hours playing either wave survival with weapons and guns with little ammo, or regular mode that takes you completing objectives by yourself or with strangers and friends. Hyper realistic zombie health. Great graphics, runs well. Get this game now before it starts costing money.

Get Infected, pop some pills.
Get cut, use some bandages.
Almost dead, use an insanely realistic medkit.

Want to blow the head off a zombie, or kill 2 or more, use a shotgun.
Want to stay safe and pop them down one at a time, use a sniper.
Want to use a weapon that can be fire from any range, but delivers and ok blow, use a pistol.
Want to play it cool, use a melee weapons (Note- Easy To Get Hit While Using Melee)-Hyper Realistic

9.5/10
+Great Gameplay
+Most Realistic Zombie Game On Steam
+Great Multiplayer
+Endless Hours Of Fun
+Free

-Not Enough Game Modes (Only Waves And Regular)

reviewText:
No More Room In Hell

It is the end of all things. It is cold. It may be painful. It may cause nothing more than agony, yet it may bring nothing but a sweet embrace of nothing. It is coming. It is your fate. No matter how far you go. No matter how far you run. No matter how many you kill. You might escape once, twice, three times, ten times, but you can't escape death forever. The dead are out there, and the pain they'll bring as they devour you, piece by piece, can be what kills you, yet the threat isn't always the dead themselves, as the infection thrives in the living, killing them on spot. Perhaps you're infected. No one knows yet, but if you turn, it could ruin everything and kill everyone! But wait, maybe you can still make it? The choice remaims yours, yet it isn't always the case, as your friends, or strangers are there to make the choice for you, or even before you.

I find this game to be fun, from when I am slaughtering zombies, or watching the people around me die in horrible ways. The situations I've been thrown into with this game were unexpected by me, and even some others I guess, and others were just cool situations to be in. I've had to choose, between me and my group several times, where'd I'd be infected with no way of survival, but it was be as easy as putting the gun to my head, and killing myself. Other times, it was up to me, or a friend to get the objective done while defending against the horde that craved our flesh. I was once even thrusted into the middle of a roleplaying game, where we had to escape the city, but had no idea how. I enjoyed these experiences quite much, and made many friends while playing the game, overall I'd recommend it, as it brings many fun times.

P.S: 'V' to shove

reviewText: Played it for a little more than a few hours so I gues I can say something about No More Room in Hell. First of all, it's a must play for everyone who loves this kind of games: Left 4 Dead or Killing Floor. This FREE game is just amazing. You start without a clue how to survive and progress on maps and a little bit later you find yourself truly enjoying killing zombies, planning your equipment and doing objectives. Playing No More Room in Hell with full party is great fun but even with less players you won't have any less joy. What can you expect more from survival game filled with zombies? Amazing atmosphere, great music and cooperation in order to do something - sure, you can wander around alone but that's not the point. With so many maps (official and fanmade), achievements, few difficulty levels, you can spend in this game MANY hours. Look at me. At the time I made this review I had on my count around 24 hours spend playing - and I feel like it's just beggining and there is much more for me to learn on how to survive in No More Room in Hell.\n\nPS. Did I mention that No More Room in Hell is FREE game? With that kind of games, the best you can is test it out and see yourself if it's something for you.

reviewText:
It's free. Freeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee. Completely and truly freeeeeeeeeee. That fact alone gives no excuse to not try this game out.

Realistic zombies (they look lonely, give one a hug :3). Realistic jumping (bunny hop). Realistic fatigue (nooo no no no nononono pick your arms up pickyourarmsup hit him hit him HIT HIM!). Not-so-realistic arrow flight paths (completely straight at any range? no drop? wut.)

Right off the bat, anyone will notice that this game has a particularly high difficulty curve. Pretty much gotta hit the ground running with this one. It's a good idea to look up all the controls, items, effects, and statuses BEFORE playing it. Check out the wiki while downloading it, but be prepared for a LOT of reading.

But isn't there a tutorial?" Not an in-game one. In fact

reviewText:
Great mod, hard as hell... crappy controls and brutally difficult even with a group of competent people. If you're up for a challenge then this is definitely the best zombie survival experience you could ever encounter for realism"... I use that term loosely as there is no such thing as the dead coming back to life... but we can always dream. :)

Unfortunately the mod itself still needs a lot of work and the community was basically DOA... I played this mod pretty hard core in the first few weeks and there were a lot of active players but now it's pretty much finished and most people have moved on.

Luckily if you hit it up pretty hard in the early release there were some Taiwanese "fun" servers with infinite ammo
recommended: one shot kills and gun spawning menus but that's all gone away since the recent patches... So yeah
hoursPlayed: have fun killing 1000 zombies with your bare fists legit. :P"
voteText: January 4, 2014
helpfulPercent: true
votesTotal: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText:
So, you're bored. You want a new zombie apocalypse game... You want to relive the carnage of death and the storm of lead fired from guns, burrowing into mutated former people that want your BRAINS!!! Something like Left 4 Dead or Killing Floor, right?

Then this game is not for you! Why? Because No More Room in Hell tries its very hardest to be the most accurate visualisation on a realistic zombie apocolypse. And it does it so very well!

How? First of all guns are scarce and ammo for said weapons even more so, so say good bye to the gun totten ways of L4D! The game focuses on making use of what you have around you, no gun store or supply shed, later KF! The melee is intensive, with the weight system making you decide whether to have the heavy zombie killers and give up your mobility? Or the light weapons which put your life in danger at every swing, but allow you to make a quick escape?

There are no special zombies which can spit acid or climb walls, or even just freakishly large ones which eat a ton of lead. Just walkers, runners and children. That's right, children! What? Do you think once the apoclypse begins children are just going to become immune or simply vanish?

These are some of the things that make me love this game! Of course there is so much depth to the game which Im not going to show here, but for such a great game to be free, who wouldn't download this!

10/10

reviewText: Another chilling example of cinematic excellence by acclaimed director Lars von Tier, No More Room in Harlem is a gripping coming-of-age biopic about the Troubles of growing up in the shadow of dope slingers and gang bangers in the impoverished half of the Big Apple. Starring Jayden Smith as Te'Niel Dadaist, a street wise hood orphan who grew up on the wrong side of the tracks, and ‎Quvenzhané Wallis as the happy-go-lucky Alicia Wunduhlund whose only got 5 months to live. Also starring Anthony Mackie as Big Wood, this cultural phenonemon is already sweeping the globe and bringing those who have lived through the Troubles standing up and proclaiming proudly, with their hearts full and their eyes damp, I was there."\nTL;DR 10/10 It's free

reviewText: I really like this game. It is very fun, however it suffers from problems that make it incredibly frustrating at most times, and other moments laughable. No more room in a hell is a SURVIVAL CO OP game, you need teammates, and you need ones that are willing to communicate with you. Most players will take everything in a room preventing you from supplies you need. However you can't fault the game for it's players. The games main mode is objective mode. It's fun, and gives you purpose, but at times the missions, can be challenging especially when new to the game. However once you get, an understanding of the games mechanics you will be able to do these missions with some effort, and cooperation. I would not attempt doing these until you know how to play the game first, unless you don't mind spectating. These missions can be done alone, and when done you get a really good sense of accomplishment. On the other side of the games content. are the survival missions. They are fun, addicting, and as they can be a challenge. You work with your team to defend, an area, against waves of zombies. So far i have had, a lot of fun with the game it is very addicting, and i will play a whole lot more. My score is 9.5/10, and it’s free. Never can go wrong with free there is no reason to not download this game. Bring friends, and for the love of god search up a video, on how to play the game, it will make it a ton more fun.

reviewText:
If you don't have money, and you enjoy the feeling of moist flesh on your bare back, then this is the game for you.

I know every time I hear the sound of tearing cartilage, my panties increase in moistness. This sensation is hard to come by nowadays. Most people aren't willing to sacrifice their body the our true lord Satan, who gives me permission after the sacrifice to fondle the remnants. I have sacrificed all of my friends and family already, so trying to sacrifice a complete stranger would be a bit awkward. Fortunately, virtual reality steps in and brings my fond childhood memories to life.

Normally these shooters cost money, which in my opinion, does not make me moist. I used to be able to receive the sensations from the trailers and demos, but I had a craving for more. Unfortunately, I haven't figured out which bodily fluid to go in which slot on my computer, but eventually I will be able to deposit some money. For right now, No More Room In Hell has satisfied almost all of my cravings and twisted desires, and heck, the graphics can look booty-laceratin' good with a beefy computer.

Overall, I'd give it a 9/10. Would definitely play on the weekend. Alone. With lotion. And the severed leg of an Indian toddler.

reviewText:
I played this mod since the very beginning, despite the countless amount of stability issues it certainly was still enjoyable. However right now I don't feel for playing it anymore for some reasons.

A blend of good and bad things:
- There has been little content added ever since the first release.
- Many bugs are still there, even bugs from the very first release.
- Too many Survival mode maps which is boring! The survival mode surely is way too cheap. The zombie AI is too bland and gives no real challenge at all. Waiting for waves with few zombies, easily bested in a few min will quickly get boring...
- Too little objective mode maps. Obviously I understand that there is more effort needed into objective maps. However the objective maps surely are the most entertaining part of NMRiH.
- Good textures, weapon animations and level design. I really can't complain on the quality made there. But that will not change my experience of enjoyment...

If you've never played this mod before then give it a go. However in my opinion you'll easily get tired of it...
voteText: 6 of 9 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
First thing is first with this game. I HATED it for the first 30 minutes or more. But after these short minutes were over I got into the spirit of the game. The looting fun and zombie 'head exploding' goodness.

Personally I prefer survival maps as they are a real challange and objective maps take a lot of time and normally result in someone doing something wrong (explosives). My friends are terrible at this game but we have a laugh killing zombies and spectating each other afterwards.

It does feel very realistic and it succeeds at not crossing the line between realistic and fun. Gun physics seem quite strong too. They aren't too flimsy feeling and you don't want to shed bullets like snake skin.

If you do play this game just make sure you have some friends to stick with. There are lots of nice people on this game (I've met two new friends (and I don't make friends often) ). But either way you don't want to be stuck with a team of 'new' people who havn't got a clue what they are doing and play the game like L4D and they do like to waste resources on each other.

Do play this game - it's amazing and FREE!

reviewText:
This is basically what I thought what Left 4 Dead was going to be back when I heard about it in '07. When L4D turned out to be more along the vein of 28 days, it would be a lie to say I wasn't a little disappointed.

No more room in Hell is the best zombie game I've ever played. Mainstream titles have been reluctant to follow the classic Romero zombie formula and NMRIH fills that great big gap. Although it's clunky it's perfectly playable and heaps of fun -headshots only, scarce ammo and zombie bites make for an incredible and tense experience.

The game's free so there is absolutely no reason not to check it out. One can hope that this mod will blow up and one day have it's own fully fledged retail release.

reviewText: This game is a slower paced FPS, but is surprisingly difficult. The button mechanics are a bit funky and has a slower response time than other games. Yes, there are quite a few glitches in this game as well as server crashes (which happens quite often) that haven't been addressed in over the years?\n\nYes, there was some enjoyable game play despite all the above, however, the NMRiH community itself has ruined this game for me. From the most abusive Admins I've ever encountered (spawning, killing and insulting fellow players) just to bully players they don't like into submission, or the server mod/cheats/hacks wherever you go!? This game use to be challenging and based upon co-op game play, but now it's a community full of cheating, hacking, rude immature players. Where I cannot recommend NMRiH anymore.

reviewText: At first sight, i thought this Zombie Survival horror Game would be just a walk in the Park just like Left 4 dead. I was wrong! well technically you see. In Left 4 dead, you just mow down zombies with a shotgun and slashing your way out with ease, while in here. YOU WILL BE RUNNING FOR YOUR SWEET LIFE FROM THOSE UGLY ABOMINATIONS! With High difficulty level, they are very hard to bring them down and ammo is scarce, so you will mostly rely on melee weapons and be alert in your environment, if you hear your heart beats faster, it means your stamina is low and you will be having a hard time swinging your melee. There is NO Crosshair which means you rely on the aiming, aim for the head and make sure each bullet aren't wasted, otherwise you're just giving the zombie having the moment of Matrix Dodging scene. The only way to know if you are infected is that... You can see your screen covering with veins purple or greenish thing, there is a temporary cure which its the Pill that only last for 5 minutes. Or you can just tell your teammates to kill you to prevent turning you into a Runner. OVERALL! The environments were very immersive, zombies are quite scary in the darkness. It catches the feel of the zombie apocalypse, good graphics, great gameplay, realistic zombies. You can play the game in Single player or Multiplayer. Best Part? It's a Free Game!\n\nRated: 9.6/10

reviewText: First off let's get one thing clear. I am a lifelong zombie afficionado. I love zombie related games, movies, and all things of the walking corpse variety. That being said there is only one thing I have to say about this game. This game is a zombie lover's dream. It's pretty spot on for the look and feel of the things that made the genre great. There's that feeling of isolation,  having to counting your ammo, being forced to rely on people you may not like in order to survive, and of course hordes of the walking dead coming at you at all times. In my opinion it is a game made for fans of the genre by the fans of the genre. Although anyone who enjoys a good game should most assuredly give it a shot as well. There are a few things that need a little more polish but the developers of this game are active in it's community and seem to be always continuing to make this game even better. Even if you don't like the counting the ammo aspect of this game there are more than enough private servers on this game with infinite ammo enabled to get rid of that problem if it isn't your thing (I for one enjoy having to count my shells from time to time because of the challenge it represents). I love how each weapon has it's own distinctive feel (even if it's only a subtle difference) and the little details on each map that displays how much time was put into this game to make it awesome. There's nothing bad I can find to say about this game other than the movement of the players is interesting to watch to say the least.

reviewText:
Quick SummaryA quality F2P team based zombie game.

Purchase Verdict:  Free, and worth playing

Point of Interest-This game actually creates a very fitting atmosphere for a post-apocolyptic world, unlike many other zombie shooters out there.

-Two different gamemodes, being survival (you and a team of players survive in an area until you get rescued) and objective (you and a team complete linear objectives in order to be rescued)

-Decent spread of ammunition and supplies. Melee weapons are vital.

-Game actually requires some critical thinking and strategizing to successfully get through a game.

reviewText: No More Room in Hell has amazing atmosphere, great music, and good if not original game design. The maps are very well detailed and the lighting is excellent. It doesn't even feel like a source engine game at times. The animations are okay but some of the voice acting is bad. I never once noticed a dip in framerate.\n\nThis mod's biggest problem is the clunky mechanics and bad/nonexistant lag compensation, even with a low ping. Most of the melee weapons are total crap but even they are better than the guns. You always want to aim where a zombies head is going to be, not where they are. This is especially problematic when paired with some of the zombie walking animations.

reviewText:
Have you ever played a game like Left 4 Dead and feelt that it needed to be a bit morre challanging? Well with this only a single  bite can make you turn if you do not treat it imedietly.
No More Room in Hell features proximity-based voice chat, meaning only teammates and zombies near you can hear you, a stripped-down HUD, limited ammo, and a lot of teamwork is needed if you want to survive some of the maps. I absolutley recomend you to try this game especially if you got a friend or two to play with.
With all thos good things there are also some bad things about this game. To start wiht tha animations sucks. Your guy runs around like he ♥♥♥♥ his pant. A lot of bugs with the hitboxes and a lot of lag whith servers. But keep in mind that they are fixing these things and it will get a lot better!

My final thought: If you like FPS games with Zombies then get this and play with your friends! I really recomend it!

reviewText:
There's most likely going to be a lot of criticism towards anyones opinions that are 'against' this mod, and for those who do so, you're simply going to be ignored.

Firstly, NMRIH does well on atmosphere and environment. The level design could do with some work, I've noticed some areas on maps that are just ridiculous and not well suited for the mods style of gameplay. However the settings it portrays are realistic and very immersive. The atmosphere is created very well not only from the map design but also from the sounds, the lighting as well as the gloomy soundtrack in the background. It all creates for a eery and perfectly matched apocalyptic setting.

The core gameplay mixes dependant on the gamemode and maps and other aspects. Most of the time you'll be doing pretty much the same thing, but it can get pretty intense and NMRIH does well to remind you just how realisitcly challenging a zombie apocalypse could really be. You'll have to spare ammo to other surivors or saviour your firearms for when you really need them. You'll have to quickly decide what tools and weapons to take as you only have a set limit of items you can carry. You'll have to learn to identify ammo types and weather or not you need them for your weapons or not. You'd be wise to avoid combat with zombies unless you really need to...

That last bit of advice goes without saying, the melee system in this mod is flawed. If you can manage it, you'll be lucky to club a zombie around the head as hard as you humanly can (forceful blunt weapon trauma to the head clearly isn't the way to KO a zombie) and get away with it.  Most of the time, you'll get grabbed and be forced to shove the zombie off of you, before realising that you've almost instantantiously been infected from barely seconds of being throttled...

Personally I'm all for realism but NMRIH really fails to deliver a satisying approach to the melee and survival approach when you've been, pardon my French, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥tted" by a mere shambler despite how full your health is or despite your best efforts to redecorate a zombies face. The melee system isn't rewarding in the slightest
date: it's damn right awkward and just ridiculous. The way around I found is to charge up your attack
recommended: then carefully execute an attack from behind or at a distance. A lot of livid fans have spoken up and mentioned that this adds to the realism. It doesn't. It makes the gameplay an annoying struggle. The concept of little ammo and salvaging precious items is fun
hoursPlayed: but badly made melee combat in a zombie apocalypse game that offers that concept of combat more
voteText: over firing precious rounds is scandalous.\n\nI guess in a sense

votesTotal: the gamemodes offer
votesFunny: or rather push the players to test their survival skills as well as teamwork capability. However when so many players are used to being the lone wolf

reviewText: The No More Room In Hell mod is the very first game I ever played on my PC and Steam, in which I met some of the best people I've ever met before, and some have became my best friends, including my dearest friend/lover, Gursh :) This game also is what got me into PC gaming. So the mod holds a dear place in my heart because of what it opened up for me. I have to admit I like the mod better than the full game, but the full game is just as fun and I enjoy it greatly. NMRIH is one of my all time favorite zombie games. I love the realism in the game. If there was a zombie apocalypse to ever break out, I feel like this game shows how it would really be. Ammo is rare, and you have to rely on a melee weapon most of the time. I love playing with my friends and having the team work to complete the game, and trying your best to survive as long as you can.

reviewText: NMRiH is a co-operative zombie survival FPS which puts the player in an eerie, darksome environment in which they must obtain weapons and ultimately fight to survive in its unforgiving setting. Maps are assigned one of two modes: Survival and Objective. In Survival, players are swarmed with waves of zombies and their objective is to survive as long as possible until rescue and defend predesignated areas, called zones". If you or your party fail to protect your zone

reviewText:
non-serious review:
>punched a zombie in the head
>zombie's brain explodes all over the place
>me and my cousin ROFL like ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥
>cousin calls me Chuck Norris after that
serious review:
This game is hard as balls, Duke Nukem's to be more specific. In all my experience of playing this game, only like 2 times I won an objective map and once I won a survival map. To expand a little, objective maps place you and your buddies in a series of mostly linear events, whereas survival maps are about holding a certain area off from the zombies which get harder every wave. First few waves you get slow, easy to kill zombies, then you get a tad bit stronger zombies with slight chances for some zombies to have the ability to run, then you get even harder zombies with the chance to infect you and rarely a little zombie kid who hits you and runs away. Oh, and when you get infected, you can either tell your team that you are infected so that they can kill you, find and swallow a pack of pills to stop your transformation into a zombie or just suicide by pointing your weapon, say, a pistol, at your head.
Weapons are pretty rare in this game, like their ammo, but what I found best was using an axe, a sledgehammer or, best of all, a tomahawk and just hold your primary attack button to charge your swing. You can weild with certain weapons a flashlight, and that's where I say that the best weapon in this game is the tomahawk, because it's small, deals a pretty nice amout of damage, and it's also the only melee weapon that you can use your flashlight with (but if you count your fists as melee weapons then it's the second only melee weapon with which you can carry a flashlight). When I said that the tomahawk is small I said that because there is also a pretty nice inventory system, where you can either hold a sledgehammer and an axe and nothing else and move super slow, all your healthpacks, bandages, flashlights and pills with an unlikely chance of having a pistol/tomahawk and a shotgun with ammo aplenty. In this game, you don't have a HUD most of the time, but you do have your ammo bar show up whenever you check how much ammo you have left in your clip by holding down the reload button (and occasionally shouting like an idiot that you have 6 shells left in your shotgun). And you can choose which character you want to play as and what voice to have.
The only downside in the game is that the community can be a little bit bad at some times but if you play with your friends, you will have a ton of fun! And just as I'm writing the review I remembered that you can also have a hammer with which you can nail planks on walls and windows, and that the same hammer is, in my opinion, a direct upgrade of the tomahawk since it does a little bit more damage, has the same inventory space and you can hold a flashlight with it.
TL;DR: This game is fantastic, and above all else, it's FREE!

reviewText: Well...Do you know Left for Dead? This game is exactly like Left for dead. Yes, there aren´t any special Zombies like the Witch or the Charger...But for me this game is the exact copy of the Left for dead series. Either you have to defend one position from the infected nor you have to get from one place to another. reviewText:
A perfect example of a hardcore zombie experience that works
So I'll start by saying the game is 100% free! That means no microtransactions, paid DLC or marketplace to buy skins so you can't really complain.
This game started as a Half-Life 2 Mod but is literally a full conversion, there’s not much that still remains from Half-Life 2 in terms of weapons, characters, gameplay features and animations.
The game is designed to be a hardcore experience, limited resources, ammo, guns, a weight system that forces you to make choices on what you will keep and what will work better for in the long run. In a few hits you can go from being perfectly healthy to dead, either just from being hit to much, bleeding or worst of all.... Infection. Now there are medical supplies to help aid in these effects like medkits, bandages, Infection Pills and even a cure but they can be hard to find when needed the most but that’s part of what makes the game so enjoyable is the realistic experience it provides. It forces teamwork, ammo and supply conservation and many other things.

There are 2 modes, Objective and Survival. Objective is basically a campaign mode where you need to complete objectives and escape. This is a great mode and really fun to play co-op or with many other players. There are about 9 levels that offer different experiences and challenges, some very difficult with never ending zombie hordes that require quick navigation around the hordes and the objectives themselves.
Survival is the typical round by round mode that lasts for 10 rounds with a increasing rate of zombies. Not to fun on your own but enjoyable with a few others.

Professional level animations, hardcore features like no HUD, manually unload your guns and checking of your ammo means you need to be aware of how many rounds you have fired or face the consequences.

The only things I can say against it is, it would be cool to have more Objective maps or a proper campaign but I know how much work that can be, let’s hope they are working on a No More Room in Hell 2 for that :P there’s defiantly a market for hardcore zombie games.
The other is the achievements... as someone who cares about achievements, aka completionist" I like to be able to complete all achievements but some of these are just far to time consuming or unrealistically hard
date: I feel as though when designing an achievement the developer should try to complete it themselves before they add it. I'm not sure that was the case for some of these
recommended: for example: "You like a good challenge? Engage 1000 zombies in fisticuffs and win" and "Complete the following maps with AT LEAST 6 players without losing a single safe zone or incurring any casualties: Favela

reviewText:
non-serious review:
>punched a zombie in the head
>zombie's brain explodes all over the place
>me and my cousin ROFL like ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥
>cousin calls me Chuck Norris after that
serious review:
This game is hard as balls, Duke Nukem's to be more specific. In all my experience of playing this game, only like 2 times I won an objective map and once I won a survival map. To expand a little, objective maps place you and your buddies in a series of mostly linear events, whereas survival maps are about holding a certain area off from the zombies which get harder every wave. First few waves you get slow, easy to kill zombies, then you get a tad bit stronger zombies with slight chances for some zombies to have the ability to run, then you get even harder zombies with the chance to infect you and rarely a little zombie kid who hits you and runs away. Oh, and when you get infected, you can either tell your team that you are infected so that they can kill you, find and swallow a pack of pills to stop your transformation into a zombie or just suicide by pointing your weapon, say, a pistol, at your head.
Weapons are pretty rare in this game, like their ammo, but what I found best was using an axe, a sledgehammer or, best of all, a tomahawk and just hold your primary attack button to charge your swing. You can weild with certain weapons a flashlight, and that's where I say that the best weapon in this game is the tomahawk, because it's small, deals a pretty nice amout of damage, and it's also the only melee weapon that you can use your flashlight with (but if you count your fists as melee weapons then it's the second only melee weapon with which you can carry a flashlight). When I said that the tomahawk is small I said that because there is also a pretty nice inventory system, where you can either hold a sledgehammer and an axe and nothing else and move super slow, all your healthpacks, bandages, flashlights and pills with an unlikely chance of having a pistol/tomahawk and a shotgun with ammo aplenty. In this game, you don't have a HUD most of the time, but you do have your ammo bar show up whenever you check how much ammo you have left in your clip by holding down the reload button (and occasionally shouting like an idiot that you have 6 shells left in your shotgun). And you can choose which character you want to play as and what voice to have.
The only downside in the game is that the community can be a little bit bad at some times but if you play with your friends, you will have a ton of fun! And just as I'm writing the review I remembered that you can also have a hammer with which you can nail planks on walls and windows, and that the same hammer is, in my opinion, a direct upgrade of the tomahawk since it does a little bit more damage, has the same inventory space and you can hold a flashlight with it.
TL;DR: This game is fantastic, and above all else, it's FREE!

reviewText: This game is one of the best zombie survival games I have ever played. Not only it is the old fashioned zombie game without any weird mutating zombies, but because it has a certain feel of urgency when there are twenty four zombies walking toward you and you have only five bullets left. It also makes you think for the team, because even if it is possible to survive for a short period of time without any teammates, it isn't survivable for long. The infection and bleeding effects are also great addition to the experience. If you are infected, and in relatively safe location with your teammates, you can cause a lot of trouble, when you turn.  There is nothing more stressful than being with your friends and no meds, it makes you think how to save at least them from you, and thats when realism comes to play, what would one do in this kind of scenario? The answer was simple, the game has won my heart when i felt real fear when i pressed the button and the gun was turned toward my head.\nI would recomend this game anytime and to anyone.

reviewText: No More Room in Hell is a Zombie Survival game like no other.\nNot your Ordinary L4D2/COD Zombies game No More Room in Hell puts you in situations which must be completed in order to escape. You actually need to plan ahead of what you need the plan is with yourself or your friends. The game is so much of a Challenge however that your gonna wish you had all the friends in the world when your all by yourself while your friends are being eaten alive whether or not wondering if there bit or not. You also have the option to shoot yourself to save your friends getting mauled by you after you die when you turn back. Although the game gets frustrating due to the long waits of being dead. Its definitly one of the most realistic Zombie survival games ive ever seen. You can scavenge, get the campaigns over with and hurry, or play it on the Safe side and make sure safteys first! It all matters how you play and also if you trust your teammates or are pointing a Gun to there head all the time to make sure they dont kill you just for your Supplies. Its better to play with friends in this game considering that you can trust them more. If you dont have friends however you can still play Online with other people in the Community... They might just not be the best. Who are you in a Zombie Apocolapse? Do you help others or stick it alone? Show your friends how your like and help eachother survive in ''No More Room in Hell!''

reviewText:
At first when I noticed it was a free game, I wasn't expecting much. However, when I played the game, I was amazed by the gameplay, attention to detail and little 'easter eggs' thrown in here and there. It's a pretty team-based game because when you play objective mode, you have to stick with your group or else you run the risk of becoming overrun. As far as being realistic, this is the most realistic zombie FPS that I've played thus far.

A word of advice, however. Finding a good group is difficult, at least it is for me, and in my experience once you find a good game people start to lag out or simply leave the game and the quality of the team goes down substantially.

All in all, this is my favorite zombie game on PC, and maybe even my favorite zombie game of all time.

reviewText: This has got to be one of the best zombie survival games ive ever seen. Even though it isnt a long term survival type thing like, say, project zomboid, it still rocks the zombie scene. reviewText:
I personally enjoy No More Room In Hell (NMRIH) because well...
- Zombie's
- Tons Of Guns
- Co-Op
- There's A Story
You can tell the developers were trying. :P
Also.. I really like it, its fun. Blowing off zombies head's, finding supplies, trying to figure out what you need and don't need, and the frantic, heart racing intensity of being holed up in a small, dark, area, with nothing but a pistol and flashlight, and maybe a friend, to keep you alive until you find a way out or help comes and you win the mission, either way, you still have to get to the evacuation point if you want to win... And theres only so many zombies and waves.. :D
Full Rating - 10/10

reviewText:
No More Room in Hell is a completely free co-operative first person survival horror game.
The game includes:
- Co-op play with up to 8 players.
- Dynamic Objective Maps: Each time you play a map, objectives could be placed in different locations.
- Realism: No crosshairs and no HUD.
- Infection: When you get bitten by a zombie, it is possible becoming one of them. You only have a certain amount of time to heal or you will die and come back as a zombie.
- 2 game modes: Survive several waves of zombies or do objective based maps.
- A lot of maps.
- Many different weapons.

No More Room in Hell is nearly impossible to win alone, cooperation is the key to win.
Graphics are average and not up to date anymore.
The sound fits to the game. There could be more sound effects but overall it is ok.
One of the best free games on Steam, especially when playing with friends. If you search for a zombie game - Try it!

Sounds 7/10
Graphics 5/10
Gameplay 7/10
Atmosphere 8/10

reviewText:
A perfect example of a hardcore zombie experience that works
So I'll start by saying the game is 100% free! That means no microtransactions, paid DLC or marketplace to buy skins so you can't really complain.
This game started as a Half-Life 2 Mod but is literally a full conversion, there’s not much that still remains from Half-Life 2 in terms of weapons, characters, gameplay features and animations.
The game is designed to be a hardcore experience, limited resources, ammo, guns, a weight system that forces you to make choices on what you will keep and what will work better for in the long run. In a few hits you can go from being perfectly healthy to dead, either just from being hit to much, bleeding or worst of all.... Infection. Now there are medical supplies to help aid in these effects like medkits, bandages, Infection Pills and even a cure but they can be hard to find when needed the most but that’s part of what makes the game so enjoyable is the realistic experience it provides. It forces teamwork, ammo and supply conservation and many other things.

There are 2 modes, Objective and Survival. Objective is basically a campaign mode where you need to complete objectives and escape. This is a great mode and really fun to play co-op or with many other players. There are about 9 levels that offer different experiences and challenges, some very difficult with never ending zombie hordes that require quick navigation around the hordes and the objectives themselves.
Survival is the typical round by round mode that lasts for 10 rounds with a increasing rate of zombies. Not to fun on your own but enjoyable with a few others.

Professional level animations, hardcore features like no HUD, manually unload your guns and checking of your ammo means you need to be aware of how many rounds you have fired or face the consequences.

The only things I can say against it is, it would be cool to have more Objective maps or a proper campaign but I know how much work that can be, let’s hope they are working on a No More Room in Hell 2 for that :P there’s defiantly a market for hardcore zombie games.
The other is the achievements... as someone who cares about achievements, aka completionist" I like to be able to complete all achievements but some of these are just far to time consuming or unrealistically hard
date: I feel as though when designing an achievement the developer should try to complete it themselves before they add it. I'm not sure that was the case for some of these
recommended: for example: "You like a good challenge? Engage 1000 zombies in fisticuffs and win" and "Complete the following maps with AT LEAST 6 players without losing a single safe zone or incurring any casualties: Favela
voteText: Flooded
helpfulPercent: Isolated
votesHelpful: NotLD
votesTotal: Ransack" yeah..... the last achievement has a 0% global completion rate which means no one has 100% of the achievements for this game which is just not good enough.\n\n7.8/10- A Free
votesFunny: Fun

reviewText:
non-serious review:
>punched a zombie in the head
>zombie's brain explodes all over the place
>me and my cousin ROFL like ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥
>cousin calls me Chuck Norris after that
serious review:
This game is hard as balls, Duke Nukem's to be more specific. In all my experience of playing this game, only like 2 times I won an objective map and once I won a survival map. To expand a little, objective maps place you and your buddies in a series of mostly linear events, whereas survival maps are about holding a certain area off from the zombies which get harder every wave. First few waves you get slow, easy to kill zombies, then you get a tad bit stronger zombies with slight chances for some zombies to have the ability to run, then you get even harder zombies with the chance to infect you and rarely a little zombie kid who hits you and runs away. Oh, and when you get infected, you can either tell your team that you are infected so that they can kill you, find and swallow a pack of pills to stop your transformation into a zombie or just suicide by pointing your weapon, say, a pistol, at your head.
Weapons are pretty rare in this game, like their ammo, but what I found best was using an axe, a sledgehammer or, best of all, a tomahawk and just hold your primary attack button to charge your swing. You can weild with certain weapons a flashlight, and that's where I say that the best weapon in this game is the tomahawk, because it's small, deals a pretty nice amout of damage, and it's also the only melee weapon that you can use your flashlight with (but if you count your fists as melee weapons then it's the second only melee weapon with which you can carry a flashlight). When I said that the tomahawk is small I said that because there is also a pretty nice inventory system, where you can either hold a sledgehammer and an axe and nothing else and move super slow, all your healthpacks, bandages, flashlights and pills with an unlikely chance of having a pistol/tomahawk and a shotgun with ammo aplenty. In this game, you don't have a HUD most of the time, but you do have your ammo bar show up whenever you check how much ammo you have left in your clip by holding down the reload button (and occasionally shouting like an idiot that you have 6 shells left in your shotgun). And you can choose which character you want to play as and what voice to have.
The only downside in the game is that the community can be a little bit bad at some times but if you play with your friends, you will have a ton of fun! And just as I'm writing the review I remembered that you can also have a hammer with which you can nail planks on walls and windows, and that the same hammer is, in my opinion, a direct upgrade of the tomahawk since it does a little bit more damage, has the same inventory space and you can hold a flashlight with it.
TL;DR: This game is fantastic, and above all else, it's FREE!

reviewText: Co-op zombie game. Two game modes: survival (resisting waves of zombies) and objective walkthrough (you running the map following certain objectives, until you get rescued). Zombies can be really strong and infect you fastly; but on the other hand you walk pretty slow. Every object you take has a weight, so you'll have to evaluate what you pick up. What else can I say about the game I started to play computer games with? Oh, yeah. It's free and it's constantly being developed. So just take it as a low-cost L4D :P

reviewText:
Honestly one of the best co-op games I have ever played. If not the best.
It's challenging, ammo and health are in short supply, you take more than a sliver of health every time you're hit, and some melee weapons feel heavier and bulkier than others, meaning it's harder to swing them around. This game is fun to play with strangers, but the best to play with friends.
Also, dicking around with sv_cheats 1 doesn't ruin the game. It opens up exploration if you're stuck and lets you discover easter eggs you can only find by using cheats.
TL;DR: Fun game with friends and sv_cheats 1 doesn't ruin it.

reviewText:
It's good. I definitely like it, it's also hard, but that really adds to the game's atmosphere and overall feel. It moves at a nice pace for co-op, it makes you take it slow and not rush through things. The game really does give you a chance to work things out with your team before partaking in the action, and there's usually plenty of loot to go around. Overall, I'd reccomend it, but mainly as a time killer. I don't play it much recreationally, and it's really only a lot of fun when you have a good team of friends to do it with. A+ on Coop, a little lacking in single player.

reviewText: This is most definitely the best game I have ever played on Steam; there's something about blasting a horde of zombies to bits with TNT whilst you pick off the stragglers with your sniper rifle that's extremely satisfying on a very primal level. I constantly find myself coming back to this game, whether if its to relax after a busy day by cracking a few skulls, or if myself and my friends decide we need to sate a bit of bloodlust. The cooperative multiplayer can be hilarious, infruiating and fantastic all within the course of one match, even if it is a little tedious waiting for the last idiot to be ripped to pieces so you can start the round again. If you're not super anal about graphics and enjoy roasting things to a crispy second death, this game is for you.

reviewText: NMRiH isa pretty unique survival horror game, for in most of its kind, you run around killing zombies with nearly infinite ammunition and little to no consequences. In this game, instead, you can't simply do that. Zombies are not easy to kill, and they don't die with one simple hit with a bat, or fall on their backs because you pushed them gently. Killing them takes it's time, being a clean headshot the easiest way to kill them. Oh, and in that matter, ammo is VERY limited, so you hace to be careful about where you're shooting, for only one bullet CAN be a big deal. This game is amazing with friends, teamwork can really help you. You trust your friends, so you can help each other out. However, on a public server... You don't know who you're with. You doubt of your teammate.  This is a blessing-curse, since if a zombie apocalypse happened in real life, you're stuck with who you're with. But lack of communication can be a real downside. Oh, and zombie children... This game has some balls.\nI'd give it a 9/10, very enjoyable.\nP.S: I've seen many reviews of this game, but many of them barely have text... If you're going to review something, I suggest you state the points you see flawed" of a game. Also

voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
[Note: I brought up some of the topics below in the forums with the developers and eventually the conversation devolved into an unpleasant experience with one of the developers. It got to the point where he (I'm assuming it was a he) responded with flippant, sarcastic remarks to almost every one of my comments while I was trying to be respectful and serious. I wondered to myself the age and maturity of this developer. It was really disappointing to see that kind of poor attitude from a game developer and it put me off playing this for awhile. That experience doesn't reflect my opinion of this game but it makes me a whole lot less likely to support them in the future.]

NMRIH is a curious game. If you dissect and examine it by its individual flaws and merits, it should be a failure, as the negative aspects appear to outweigh the postives. But when put together I think the adage, “the whole is greater than the sum of its parts” seems to apply appropriately.

Let's look at what I mean. We'll start with the bad. First, the game has severe hit detection problems. Like basically broken. You can have your gun perfectly aimed at a zombie's head, fire, and still miss. Why? The developers have stated that the game lacks NPC lag compensation". So a moving zombie might not be where they appear to be. They'll be a little off. Their heads also seem to have small hitboxes. Ok this sounds like a huge problem right? A badly coded first-person shooter where you can't hit the enemy consistently because the game is unable to display their correct location? Many people might stop right here and look for another game. And I wouldn't blame you. But yet this seemingly monumental flaw doesn't kill the game. Not really.

The vast majority of the zombies are the slow moving type right out of a Romero film. That makes up for the lag problem some. The few that are fast run straight at you so the aiming isn't too much of an issue. It's usually when the zombies are moving sideways that it's harder to hit them.

Your melee attacks are also affected by the lag and it will definitely be frustrating at first. You will miss A LOT and get grabbed and bitten a bunch but with practice you learn how to swing each weapon at the right moment to compensate for it (mostly).

Melee range is another issue with the game. Some of the ranges are inconsistent or just plain don't make sense. For instance
date: you would expect that holding a lengthy object in your hand would naturally extend your reach. But strangely your fists have the longest range of all. Their attack power may be weak but their range seems to be superior to all weapons. Using the flashlight as a weapon has the shortest reach even though it looks like it should give you an extra foot of melee range. Is this logical? No. Does it detract from the gameplay? Again
recommended: not really.\n\nI think herein lies the irony. The game thrives on its difficulty. And make no mistake it is hard. You won't know where to go or what to do at first. Your guns never have enough ammo. You will most likely fail and die. But the difficulty of it makes it challenging and these broken features make it more difficult and challenging which adds to the experience. If you were going around chopping heads off like it was nothing
voteText: the game wouldn't be as fun. I still want them to fix the broken features
helpfulPercent:
but it kinda works in this game.

Another gameplay element introduced in NMRIH is proximity chat where players' mics and text have limited range and if you wander too far away other players can no longer hear your mic or see your text chat. There are walkie talkies you can pickup in the game that allow your mic to be used anywhere on the map (other players need the walkie talkies too in order to hear you) but nothing for text chat which is unfortunate because not everyone has mic (like me) so if you're too far away from everyone you are basically cut off from any communication. I'm not really a fan of this feature.

Also when you're dead you cannot communicate with people still playing. I really don't like this at all because many times you have players who don't know what they're doing and they just wander aimlessly all over the map for what seems like forever and there's nothing you can do to help them because you can't voice or text chat with them. Be prepared to spend a lot of time waiting to play in this game or leaving and joining other servers.

The game also has magically respawning zombies. Like teleporting right before your very eyes. Blah.

So
votesHelpful: given all the negative stuff I mentioned I still think the game's ok. Because the challenging nature of it is addicting (and also prone to make you ragequit). The atmosphere is dark and spooky. The levels are well designed. The child zombies are a nice creepy touch. When you die and restart
votesTotal: the previous objectives you had routinely changes so it doesn't feel stale. It takes patience to play and truly feels rewarding when you manage to survive and get rescued. And best of all it's free.\n\nWould I recommend this if it wasn't free? Based on the crude attitude of some of the devs and their inability to fix the broken gameplay
votesFunny: the answer is a resounding NO.\n\nBut since it is free you should give it a try and don't give up right away when you notice the game's flaws. Try to play through an objective-based game (There are two game modes
commentsCount: objective and wave. I recommend objective more.) See if you like it. And if you end up hating it

reviewText: At first I was a little sceptical because it seemed to be a game based around multiplayer (and I am a huge singleplayer fan) but then once I got into it, wow. I've always looked for a game that portrays the zombie apocalypse well. This not only does it well with it's gloomy settings, variety of zombies, and choice of weaponry to bash them with, but the gameplay mechanics are just fabulous once you get used to them. Zombies can grab you, multiple zombies can grab you. When fighting them there is a chance you will get hit (unless you are extremely smooth every time you strike) and you can get infected. You can die from infection and rise back up as a zombie that will attack your former allies. That is one of the crowning achievements of this game. The levels are fairly well designed as well (with the odd glitch here and there). If you get lost in the dark hallways and rooms and separated from your allies you will panic. You will run to try and find them so that you don't miss the helicopter, there is no greater feeling of dread. If you are not careful you will step a wrong foot somewhere and that adds to the horror of the whole situation, but if you work well as a team you just might make it through. It's a tough game with a steep learning curve, but every lesson is worth it. I just hope they keep making levels for this because I may just play it for years to come.

reviewText:
For those of you who have played L4D2, you will most likely have come across the realism mode. The difference between realism mode and the normal co-op mode in L4D2 is that in realism mode you cannot see the silhouette of your teammates, items, and you cannot come out of the closet (respawn) when you are dead. Most players take the realism mode as an additional challenge as it adds a certain amount of difficulty to the already challenging expert co-op mode. The aim of L4D2's realism mode is to make the game real so that you can have a taste of reality in L4D2. It works well, though when L4D2's realism mode is pitted against No More Room in Hell, L4D2 looses out in almost all aspects of realism.

The first thing you need to know about No More Room in Hell (NMRH from here on) is that it is a Mod for Source games (Half-Life 2, Portal 2, Counter-Strike: Source, Left 4 Dead 2 ... etc). Meaning, you will need at least one copy of such games installed before you can play it. The game (or mod) itself is free, so don't worry about that. Since NMRH is a mod, you can basically expect graphics and controls very similar to that of Half-Life 2 and other games based upon the source engine. There really isn't anything spectacular about the graphics and controls, so I'll leave it for you t decide for yourself.

After installing NMRH (and maybe a source based game if you have not already done so), you are ready for your first game. You go in, choose a server in a very Counter-Strike manner (opening a server list and clicking on a server you like, which most likely will be a server with the lowest ping and an empty slot), and you wait for your game to load. You will be curious how the game will be. Finally, after somewhat less than a minute (on my gear), the game is finally loaded and ...

... four empty walls.

Well, to be fair, there are some run down furnitures and the environment is decorated with cracks and dust, but the point is, where are the HUDs (Head-Up Display)? In a typical first-person shooter, there will be numbers representing your health and the amount of ammunition you are currently holding on to. Alright, I was not holding a gun so maybe I don't get to see any numbers representing any bullets. Fine. But what about my health? What I have found out, later on, is that there are no in-game HUDs that represents your health value. On the other hand, health is represented by the colour saturation of your in game graphics - the lower the value of your health is, the lower the colour saturation will be and your screen will look pretty much grayscale-ish before you fall on your face. Also, your screen will be highlighted red if you are injured or infected (the highlight for each condition differs from each other).

After walking around for a bit, triggering green silhouettes whenever you look at items lying around (or red when your backpack is full) and picking them up, I soon come to realize that there actually are HUDs in the game. One is your Fallout-3-like compass (remember, you don't have a map). Another is the item and ammo screen (1, 2). The third are the instructions given, which will pop out in the middle of your screen when you've triggered them. The last one is the number of ammunition you have (at least you get to see how much ammo you have left, phew!).

Speaking about guns, the game tries to make its item system as realistic as possible, just like many other aspects of the game. In order to do so, the game uses something similar to a weight system" for its item system (something like Killing Floor
voteText: higher dammage items takes up more weight
